results.title: Fires of the mind: workings of the human brain
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Outlines findings of current research into the workings of the human brain - its anatomy and physiology, discoveries concerning its evolution and research into such areas as memory, the sense of self, and the human mind’s ability to reflect upon itself.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED

results.title: The Infinite voyage
results.creator_credit: Chip Walter, National Academy of Sciences and WQED
results.brief_description: Focusing on current and compelling scientific topics, this series is a unique visual presentation that inspires students to see their world in new ways and discover how modern technologies contribute to scientific discovery. These programs go beyond the latest technology reports in newspapers, magazines, and television to the personal stories of people at the boundaries of scientific research. A journey to the very brink of scientific exploration where individuals and technology meet the unknown.

results.title: Unseen worlds: imaging from atoms to outer space
results.creator_credit: Steve Eder, National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and WQED
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Infinite voyage”.
Examines a wide range of imaging techniques and their many and varied applications, such as anthropologists using computer technology to probe the remains of Egyptian mummies to discover previously unknown facts about the health and life-style of these people, or doctors using magnetic imaging to view the brain and other organs to provide treatment without resorting to invasive techniques like exploratory surgery.

results.title: Service Leadership
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Exceptional service begins with senior management a service leadership involves staying in touch with the customers, leading by example, creating a “service culture” and gaining staff commitment.

results.title: Selling Our Services
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Improving Service”.
All service involves selling and selling entails meeting needs by asking questions and actively listening, giving advice based on product knowledge, bending the rules and taking personal responsibility for problems.

results.title: Unhappy Customers
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Unhappy customers promptly tell others about poor service. Offers the philosophy that complaints should be welcomed so that the problem can be resolved, repeat business generated and the now satisfied customer will tell others. Illustrates a step by step method in a range of service settings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions

results.title: Service Burnout
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Service burnout is a stress reaction suffered by frontline and service staff. Addresses physical and emotional symptoms, effects on customer service, prevention of burnout and how to remedy existing cases of burnout.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions

results.title: Serving People
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Customers and clients want to be served in a positive way. Frontline staff should use greetings and names, show respect for unusual requests, be sensitive to cultural differences and overcome language barriers.

results.title: Supervising for Service
results.creator_credit: Peter Quarry, Eve Ash and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Improving Service”.
Supervisors need to support frontline staff in serving customers by providing on-going training, being available when problems arise, motivating staff and improving poor individual service performance.
